item.title: Cant figure this out. [PI] Multi item checking
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Instead of placing if statements inside the case statement (which most will never be called), why not just add seperate case statements?

Like this:

if (!c.getItems().playerHasItem(#, 1)) //checks if you have it, and this is called BEFORE the switch
     return;
switch (#)
{
     case #:
          //do that
          break;
     case #:
          //do that
          break;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Cant figure this out. [PI] Multi item checking
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

Hi, Basically i’m coding a new system for my server. But basically i don’t want to have to do something like this

case #####: if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do this } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do this } else (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } break;

otherwise it would be a huge code like this

case #####: if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do this } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do this } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } else (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } break; case #####: if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do this } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do this } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } else if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } else (c.getItems().playerHasItem(####, 1) { //do that } break;

for like 15 different case id’s and 15 different outcomes, Is there a better way of doing it?

Read full topic
